lines.text: What are you thinking?
I'm thinking I asked you not to talk. And now you've said things I'll always remember.
This could have been a sexy talk.
Surely a suburban man has a right to dance with his mistress in his own home.

[pause]
Marlene isn't your mistress. She's your Red Herring.
My what?

Your Red Herring. The properly equipped suburban man, as you call him, has a wife, a mistress, and a Red Herring. His Red Herring is the woman was maybe was his mistress once or may become one in the future, but they aren't sleeping now. You can always tell because they act as if they are.
Wow! That's decadent, sweetie. What's been happening to that pure, unsullied mind of yours lately?
What's that you said earlier about my wanting you to be more interesting than you are? Do you really think that?
Of course. I think you left Jack and me alone deliberately last night.
Could I be so perverse?
You're kidding.
I don't think you need a lover to be more interesting. I think your pretty interesting anyway. Here... and here...
I said JUST a nap.
And here...
Your lover just called.
What did he say?
Nothing. He hung up.
In summers past, my during-the-week absence had made your weekend heart grow fonder.
I wasn't feeling well last night, that's all.

[pause]
Would you say that sex is the only sore point in our marriage?
Mmm. Yes.
Shouldn't we do something about it?
Like what?
Maybe we should give it up.

[pause]
I've never heard that as a solution.
Want one for the road?
One what?
I don't know whether to be insulted or flattered.
You can decide later.
What's Daddy eating?
Your Daddy has bought himself a cabbage!
